level.heading: Temporary Repeal of Section
level.text: Section 17 of D.C. Law 17-63 repealed this section as of the date when the District of Columbia Free Clinic Captive Insurance Company becomes operational.
Section 19(b) of D.C. Law 17-63 provides that the act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 6-155, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 1-307.21.

level.heading: Delegation of Authority
level.text: Delegation of authority pursuant to Law 6-155, "Free Clinic Assistance Program Act of 1986", see Mayor's Order 87-32, February 5, 1987.
Delegation of authority, see Mayor's Order 88-100, April 26, 1988.

level.heading: Miscellaneous Notes
level.text: Expiration of Law 6-155: See Historical and Statutory Notes following § 1- 307.21.

Repeal of Part B: Section 16 of D.C. Law 17-196 provides: "The Free Clinic Assistance Program Act of 1986, effective September 23, 1986 (D.C. Law 6-155; D.C. Official Code § 1-307.21 et seq.), is repealed as of the date when the Agency becomes operational."
